chunks.chunk_text: She's like,mom,don't say that.Modermedicine is very,very effective.But at that time,going through chemo,she got all these emotions.She's like,you know,let me hold your hand,because I might not be here tomorrow.And I'm like,you know what?You're going to wake up tomorrow.You're going to ask me for food.But that's good.She's very in the moment.No,she was afraid.It was all about that fear.And then when the chemo got really tough,because the first few sessions,she sort of had it in her body and she

chunks.chunk_text: started to ache.And then halfway through all the sessions,she's got eight sessions of chemo.About session five,session six,her joints would be very,very painful during the few months.So it was from fear to every day she wanted to give up.She was like,you know what?I hate this life.This sucks.I can't sleep at night.I'm aching all over.And I'm like,you're almost done.Eight sessions.You're on session six,right?Two more.And it's over.You're running the last mile right now.

chunks.chunk_text: And she's like,oh,I'm done.I'm too old for this and blah,blah,blah.And then,you know,she gets very emotional.I had to sort of calm her down to talk her out of her fears.And I said,I'm going to be here.Everybody's going to be okay.And you just got to fight this through,because we're all in this together.Yeah,you fight for us.No,no.When she gets to that point,you know,your mom is like,I'm too old.You know,your mom's too old.I'm sorry.You guys got to take care of yourself.She just wants to give it up.

chunks.chunk_text: Yeah,she just wants to give up,because for her,she's never experienced that.And all that chemotherapy,I don't know what is it that they inject into her body that goes through her blood.It resides in her body.So at night,she gets very hot.And then her joints gets very swollen.So for her,like quality of life deteriorated,and then she just wanted to give up.And,you know,now,you know,she survived cancer five years.And I tell her sometimes,and I said,you said you want to give up.
